Rule.Name: Ensure symmetric keys use AES_128 or stronger algorithm
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'Symmetric Key encryption algorithm' is not set to 'AES_128' or higher in non-system databases, which may allow weak encryption.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure 'Symmetric Key encryption algorithm' is set to 'AES_128' or higher in non-system databases.
Rule.Correction: USE <DatabaseName>; ALTER SYMMETRIC KEY <KeyName> WITH ALGORITHM = AES_128;
Rule.Verification: SELECT name, algorithm_desc FROM sys.symmetric_keys WHERE algorithm_desc NOT LIKE 'AES%';

Rule.Name: Ensure asymmetric keys are at least 2048 bits
Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'Asymmetric Key Size' is set to less than 2048 bits in non-system databases, which may allow weak encryption.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure Asymmetric Key Size is set to 2048 bits or higher in non-system databases. Command: USE ; CREATE ASYMMETRIC KEY WITH ALGORITHM = RSA_2048;
Rule.Correction: USE <DatabaseName>; CREATE ASYMMETRIC KEY <KeyName> WITH ALGORITHM = RSA_2048;
Rule.Verification: SELECT name, key_length FROM sys.asymmetric_keys WHERE key_length < 2048;

Rule.Name: Ensure backups are encrypted
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Database backups are not encrypted, which may expose sensitive data.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure all database backups are encrypted. Command: BACKUP DATABASE TO DISK = 'C:\\Backup\\.bak' WITH ENCRYPTION (ALGORITHM = AES_256, SERVER CERTIFICATE = [CertificateName]);
Rule.Correction: BACKUP DATABASE <DatabaseName> TO DISK = 'C:\\Backup\\<DatabaseName>.bak' WITH ENCRYPTION (ALGORITHM = AES_256, SERVER CERTIFICATE = [CertificateName]);
Rule.Verification: SELECT name, is_encrypted FROM msdb.dbo.backupset WHERE is_encrypted = 0;

Rule.Name: Ensure network encryption is enabled
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Network encryption is not configured or enabled, which may allow unencrypted communications.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure network encryption is configured and enabled.
Rule.Verification: SELECT value_in_use FROM sys.configurations WHERE name = 'force encryption';

Rule.Name: Ensure Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) is enabled
Rule.NonCompliantComment: Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) is not enabled on databases, which may leave sensitive data at risk.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Enable Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) for databases. Command: USE ; CREATE DATABASE ENCRYPTION KEY WITH ALGORITHM = AES_256 ENCRYPTION BY SERVER CERTIFICATE [CertificateName]; ALTER DATABASE SET ENCRYPTION ON;
Rule.Correction: USE <DatabaseName>; CREATE DATABASE ENCRYPTION KEY WITH ALGORITHM = AES_256 ENCRYPTION BY SERVER CERTIFICATE [CertificateName]; ALTER DATABASE <DatabaseName> SET ENCRYPTION ON;
Rule.Verification: SELECT name, is_encrypted FROM sys.databases WHERE is_encrypted = 0;
